intro: Irvingella, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a key feature of the genus. The plants typically have thick, woody stems and produce small, inconspicuous flowers. Irvingella species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Some species are also cultivated for their ornamental value due to their unique appearance.
